title: [Large-Scale] First-Year Chemistry Foundational Education Design Based on Online Interaction: Enhancing Social Connectedness

context.prior_knowledge: High school-level chemistry foundations and general comprehension of social and scientific phenomena
context.additional_context: An online interactive environment for learners from diverse fields (medical/legal/technical) to contextualize foundational chemistry knowledge within their disciplines and societal frameworks. Medical focus: patient diagnosis/treatment protocols; Legal: environmental regulations/policy analysis; Technical: new material development/economic viability.

learning_goals: Learners can explain basic chemistry concepts (atomic structure, chemical reactions, chemical calculations) with over 80% accuracy using scientific inquiry methods.
Learners can demonstrate the social relevance of chemistry concepts to their chosen major (medical/legal/technical) through PBL (Problem-Based Learning) deliverables.
Learners improve their chemistry problem-solving skills by over 70% through online quizzes and video content and can apply these skills to real-world social issues.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
